recordTypes.name: Subdivision Plat
recordTypes.description:
Anderson County Development Moratorium Information.

Anderson County Ordinance 2025-036 hereby declares and places a moratorium suspending the acceptance and or issuance of any new permits for development for a period of 90 Days for properties located within the unincorporated areas of Anderson County. 
Please Note: The Council, by subsequent ordinance, may extend the temporary suspension and temporary moratorium for a further time- period.

This includes the following residential uses.   

Residential subdivisions of more than 4 lots and any residential living unit, townhomes, apartments, duplexes, or any other multi- developments.

The exceptions are: 
1. Any project(s) reviewed and approved by the Planning Commission.

2. Existing lots of records that have been recorded in the Register of Deeds Office.
3. Pending litigation cases involving residential subdivisions and developments.

4. Towns and cities within Anderson County are not affected by this moratorium because they are separate jurisdictions and a separate form of government and council.

5. Creation of lots that are 5 acres in size that are located along an existing street or road where no new street or road is created as per state law.

6. Commercial and Industrial Development.
This moratorium takes effect on September 2, 2025, due to the pending doctrine under state law that recognizes effective adoption of ordinance upon first reading which was September 2, 2025.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: Zoning regulates the allowable uses of land in certain areas of Anderson County. “Rezoning” involves changes to the official zoning designation of a property. Property owners can request rezoning of their property at any time. The rezoning process does not apply to unzoned properties in the County. Rezoning is not a formality; it is a change to the County’s law governing the use of private property. Members of the public, including the applicant, have the opportunity to comment on the request at the Planning Commission meeting, and at the 1st Council reading. Postcards are sent to property owners within 2000 feet of the subject parcel, notifying them of the proposed change and the meeting schedule. Notice of the proposed change will also appear in a newspaper of general circulation. A sign(s) will be posted on the property, identifying the property as under consideration for rezoning. The sign will be removed upon completion of the rezoning process.

recordTypes.name: Medical Exception Application
recordTypes.description:
What is a medical exception?

Per Anderson County Ordinance, for residential areas, only one dwelling is allowed and permitted per a parcel. A medical exception is a special exception and permit that can potentially be granted to allow a temporary mobile home to be placed on a property where a dwelling may already exist. A medical exception is a temporary use until the applicant no longer wishes to utilize it or if the medical exception is no longer needed. Medical exceptions are required to be renewed every year and are accompanied by an annual renewal fee. Medical exceptions are usually sought after to take care of a loved one who may need assistance in day to day living.

All medical exception requests for zoned areas are required to be reviewed by the Anderson County Board of Zoning Appeals at a regularly scheduled public hearing. Is is strongly encouraged for all applicants to attend the public hearing in which their medical exception application is reviewed. This is highly suggested to applicants in case the board may have questions about an application or if those that live in the surrounding vicinity may not be in favor of the medical exception request.
